author: Staff Reporter
text:
This year’s edition of the annual national integration camp, which is organised by Nehru Yuva Kendra Sangathan bringing together participants from across the country, had an added element to it — the forthcoming Assembly elections. Held in Chennai, the event featured a voter awareness seminar and a folk dance festival based on the elections.

Sivgananam, Joint Chief Electoral Officer, Tamil Nadu, addressed the youth from Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Assam and other states and also representatives from women’s groups, urging them to exercise their franchise and contribute towards building a strong democracy.

“As responsible voters, you should not be influenced by external factors and bring to the notice of the commissioner any malpractice you may come across. Your choice now dictates the leader you will have for the next five years,” he said.

During the interactive session, M. Sanjeev from Muzzafarnagar in Uttar Pradesh raised a question about the eligibility of candidates with criminal cases being able to contest. “The candidates, in their affidavits filed during nominations, declare everything right from the assets they own to the cases pending against them. These are available for public scrutiny,” Mr. Sivagnanam responded.
title: Polls add flavour to the national integration camp
